_exec_summary.SummaryText:
United Suppliers Inc- Silver Creek, NE is committed to preventing and/or mitigating episodic chemical releases that could lead to catastrophe in the workplace and possibly the surrounding community.  

United Suppliers Inc. - Silver Creek, NE Risk Management Plan is predictive filing.  The facilities primary activities at this location is the blending and storing of wholesale liquid fertilizer.  Anhydrous ammonia is received by truck or by railcar and is blended with phosphoric acid into 10-34-0 liquid fertilizer.  This blending operation is performed by a portable T-reactor and this reaction takes place twice a year, normally during one week in the spring and one week in the fall.  Anhydrous ammonia is present at the facility only during the blending operations.

United Suppliers Inc. recognizes the portable T-reactor as part of the covered process consistent with OSHA regualtions 29 CFR Part 1910, Process Safety Management Plan.  The reactor operations may be contracted with others and covered by a separate Process Safety Management Plan (owned by the contract organization). The operation, management of change, pre-startup review, and maintenance procedures for the portable reactor operation resides with the contract organization.  The Emergency Response procedures for the Silver Creek site and contracted organization are integrated into one response, prior to the operation of the portable reactor.

United Suppliers, Inc. - Silver Creek, NE has taken the necessary steps to comply with accidental release prevention requirements set forth in 40 CFR Part 68. The following briefly describes the prevention program elements in place at this stationary source.

Process Safety Information:  The facility maintains information describing the chemical hazards, operating parameters, and equipment designs associated with the covered process.

Process Hazard Analysis:  Studies are conducted to ensure the hazards associated with process operations are identified, understood, an

d controlled.

Operating Procedures:  Written operating procedures are maintained for covered process operations.  These procedures address the following activities:  initial startup, normal, temporary, emergency shutdown, normal shutdown, and startup following a turnaround.

Training:  A program is in place to ensure employees are knowledgeable and trained in procedures associated with the covered process.

Mechanical Integrity:  Covered process equipment is maintained consistent with generally accepted engineering practices.  Covered process equipment is routinely inspected and tested.  Covered process equipment viability assessments include:  storage vessels, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls, and pumps.  Maintenance activities are conducted by qualified personnel.  Deficiencies are corrected in a timely manner.

Management of Change:  Written procedures are in place to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and/or procedures. Affected personnel are informed and trained to deal with authorized system changes.

Pre-startup Review:  Technical and operational reviews will be conducted on new processes and/or modifications to existing covered processes.  Reviews confirm the construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable.  Reviews are completed prior to placing equipment in operation.

Compliance Audits:  Internal audits are conducted on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions specified under RMP rules are being implemented.  At a minimum, these audits are conducted every three (3) years.  Any determined corrective acitons are completed in a timely manner.

Incident Investigation:  Investigations are conducted to determine the root cause of a covered process incident.  In addition to determination and correction, investigations are directed toward preventing reoccurence.  Investigations become process safety information and are retained for five (5) years.

Employee

Participation:  United Suppliers, Inc.- Silver Creek NE employees actively contribute in the following:  process hazard assessments, operating procedure development, maintenance procedure development, training development and implementation, pre-startup reviews, incident investigations, and compliance audits.  Additionally, employees have access to all information pretaining to the facilty's RMP.

Contractors:  Periodically, United Suppliers Inc, Silver Creek NE, hires contractors to conduct specialized operational, maintenance and construction activities. Prior to work and at least annually, contractors are trained an audited on the covered process, relevant process safety information and emergency response actions

Five(5) Year Accident History: There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five (5) years that have resulted in deaths, injuries or significant property damage.  Nor to our knowledge, has there been any releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage and/or environmental damage.

Emergency Action Plan:  United Suppliers, Inc. - Silver Creek NE, has a written emergency action plan.  This plan inludes notification of the Merrick County LEPC.  Local authorities have been provided with emergency plannng and community right-to-know information.

Planned changes to improve safety:  United Suppliers Inc. - Silver Creek NE, views safety improvements as a continual process.Periodic evaluations (both inernal an external) are performed to assess the facility status.  At this time, and aside from sustaining maintenance activities, there are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding anhydrous ammonia.
